messages.author: whywhat
messages.text: It deletes the view and makes the view invisible, not the screen object.

messages.author: glotov
messages.text:
On 2010/04/07 13:32:16, whywhat wrote:
> It deletes the view and makes the view invisible, not the screen object.

Done.

messages.author: whywhat
messages.text: I'd rather remove all children of ContentsView or explicitly called HideAndDelete on each screen rather than root view since we can't guarantee that some children of root view and itself are not referenced by something we don't control.

messages.author: glotov
messages.text:
On 2010/04/07 13:32:16, whywhat wrote:
> I'd rather remove all children of ContentsView or explicitly called
> HideAndDelete on each screen rather than root view since we can't guarantee that
> some children of root view and itself are not referenced by something we don't
> control.

Done.

messages.author: whywhat
messages.text: The comment here is explicitly against the change you made.

messages.author: whywhat
messages.text: If we call HideAndDelete here, probably we don't need to call anything in WizardController's dtor (which is a good thing since WizardController should not depend on its screens much).

messages.author: whywhat
messages.text: Since it's not explicitly hiding anything could we call it Destroy or Delete?

messages.author: glotov
messages.text:
On 2010/04/07 13:32:16, whywhat wrote:
> The comment here is explicitly against the change you made.

Done.
